derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French despote, via medieval Latin from Greek despotēs, 'master, absolute ruler'. Originally (after the Turkish conquest of Constantinople) the term denoted a petty Christian ruler under the Turkish empire. The current sense dates from the late 18th cent

entry.def: A despot is a ruler or other person who has a lot of power and who uses it unfairly or cruelly.
